editorialNotes.name: Beats 1
editorialNotes.standard: The best music, interviews and radio shows broadcasting now.
editorialNotes.short: The best music, interviews and radio shows broadcasting now.

attributes.name: Grateful
attributes.copyright: ? 2017 Epic Records, a division of Sony Music Entertainment

editorialNotes.standard: It’s one thing to attract as many top-tier guests to an album as DJ Khaled does. It’s another to create winning chemistry between them. Here, the producer/talent wrangler achieves that by seeking out intriguing contrasts as well as complementary voices for his string of radio-ready anthems. Travis Scott’s layered, shape-shifting vocal springs off Nas’ old-school gravitas (“It’s Secured”), Alicia Keys provides a regal counterpoint to Nicki Minaj’s bullish energy (“Nobody”), and JAY Z’s playful triumphalism bounces around Beyoncé’s steady cool (“Shining”).
editorialNotes.short: The hitmaker conjures winning chemistry from his vast VIP list.

attributes.name: Beauty and the Beast (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack) [Deluxe Edition]

editorialNotes.standard: The soundtrack to Disney’s resplendent live-action update of the animated classic gets  a similarly opulent makeover with Ariana Grande, John Legend, Josh Groban, Céline Dion, Audra McDonald, and more. The album is filled with rousing sing-along moments perfect for the family trip (“Belle,” “Gaston,” and “Be Our Guest”) or when you get that chance to belt out those high notes solo (“How Does a Moment Last Forever,” “Beauty and the Beast”).
editorialNotes.short: Get ready to choreograph your own “Be Our Guest” spectacle.

attributes.name: Nothing But the Beat Ultimate
attributes.copyright: ? 2012 What A Music Ltd., licence exclusive Parlophone Music France

editorialNotes.standard: By the release of 2011's Nothing but the Beat, David Guetta had essentially remade pop in his own image; his brand of exuberant dance music had become the de facto template for chart success. Hence this album's list of guests, which reads like a GRAMMY® red carpet: Lil Wayne, Usher, Jennifer Hudson, Snoop Dogg, etc. Featuring vocals from Nicki Minaj, "Turn Me On" is one of EDM's most enduring anthems, while the majestic "Titanium," with vocals from cowriter Sia, reflects Guetta's growing interest in anthemic rock tropes. "Without You" marries Usher's indelibly earnest crooning with Guetta's Ibiza-inspired pop-timism, and somehow even the typically laid-back Snoop Dogg sounds at home amid the churning beats of "Sweat."
editorialNotes.short: Where the Frenchman's brand of A-list dance became the template for chart success.

attributes.name: POISON
attributes.copyright: ? 2018 Epic Records, a division of Sony Music Entertainment/Swizz Beatz Productions, Inc.

editorialNotes.standard:
Some 20 years deep in the music industry, Bronx-bred producer and rapper Swizz Beatz is still able to coax groundbreaking performances out of seasoned MCs like Nas, Pusha T and Lil Wayne—artists who have long cemented their individual legacies as innovators. Though there are guests on every track, Swizz's second album, Poison, is less a compilation of assorted collaborations than a collection of inspired performances united under a singular vision, each one somehow living up to the brilliance of the last. The recent Harvard Business School graduate tells Apple Music his methods for getting the most out of his collaborators in the studio — and how they happen to double as MBA-caliber, Fast Company-approved leadership tenets.
Focus on Strengths “I think I got the best out of these artists because I actually have concepts; it’s not just about throwing them a beat. Look at what Young Thug was able to deliver [on “25 Soldiers”]. I just produce him in a way that is different than people normally hear him. And it was fun to take Nas, put him on “Echo”, and have a story in 2018 that's just so ill coming from one of our poets—the Langston Hughes of rap.”
Have a Vision “The criteria for the album was that everybody had to deliver the best that you know them for or better. It was like, 'Is this the one of the best Nas verses you've heard in a long time?' Yes. Look at what Wayne was able to do off 'P.O.M.S.'— he was able to launch! And then we hit ‘em with “Uproar” [from Tha Carter V]. It was important for me to have that vision with Wayne, but it was important for Wayne to deliver on that vision; it's an equal exchange.”
Make Connections “I wanted to make 'We Gon' Make It Pt. 2' and hear Styles and Kiss go back and forth like that. I wanted the chorus [for “Something Dirty/Pic Got Us”] to be big in a way that people wouldn't expect. I knew Kendrick was a fan of theirs and they're a fan of Kendrick, so I was like, I can make that happen. Would it have been dope for him to kill a verse? Yeah, definitely, but I just like that fact that he's on the chorus on a Styles P and Jadakiss in-and-out.”
Don't Micromanage “Áine Zion was at a No Commissions art show in London and she did a spoken-word performance. I just thought she was dope, so I challenged her with the Poison theme ['Poison Intro']. She came back with that in like an hour and it just felt so authentic. I was like, 'There we go right there.'”
Create Safe Spaces “It’s not that I'm asking an artist to do something that's going to make them feel uncomfortable in a bad way. I might ask them to do something that they're uncomfortable with because they’ve never done it before, but that's different—that's a discovery. And all artists should be open to discovery. I'm a disruptor, right? I want to disrupt the whole shit, every chance I get.”
editorialNotes.short: A superproducer brings out the best from an all-star cast of MCs.

attributes.name: Major Key
attributes.copyright: ? 2016 Epic Records, a division of Sony Music Entertainment

editorialNotes.standard: The hitmaker’s new album is the hip-hop equivalent of an All-Star weekend. Major Key is a wildly enjoyable set of outsized radio rap whose guest list includes Nicki Minaj, Kendrick Lamar, Drake, JAY Z, Nas, Future, Travis Scott, Bryson Tiller, Lil Wayne, Fat Joe, Jadakiss, Busta Rhymes, Big Sean, J. Cole, Jeezy, Wiz Khalifa, Wale, and somehow, so many more.

description.standard: This is the world's best new music playlist. Add it to your library now.
description.short: The world's best new music playlist.

description.standard: Chill tracks to enhance your focus.
Crank out more reps and more sweat with this hard-hitting playlist. Get fierce with your fitness and Unleash the Beast with blazing hot tracks.

editorialNotes.standard: Beats by Dr. Dre puts you backstage, on the field, and in the front row, curating unique experiences for music, sports, and fashion.  We take you inside the point of view of the world’s top artists, athletes, and creators to inspire you like no one else can.
The best music for you, across every genre, updated regularly.
editorialNotes.short: The best music, just for you.

editorialNotes.standard: Discover the world of cutting-edge electronic dance music with this growing selection of playlists curated by the Telekom Electronic Beats editorial team. From Berlin techno to esoteric house and beyond, this is the music of the underground.

attributes.name: No Brainer (feat. Justin Bieber, Chance the Rapper & Quavo)

editorialNotes.short: All hail Justin’s tache! The instant summer anthem gets a joyous vid.
